Authors:
Carlos A. Salvador Montoya, Orlando F. Popoff, Mateus
Arduvino Reck, Ricardo Drechsler-Santos
Title:
Morphological revision and molecular phylogenetic analyses
raised new perspectives for the Fulvifomes (Hymenochaetales,
Basidiomycota): F. squamosus sp. nov.
Keywords:
Hymenochaetaceae, taxonomy, polypore, host distribution,
geographic distribution.
Abstract:
Abstract: Morphological revision of Fulvifomes robiniae,
as well as phylogenetic inferences based on nITS and nLSU markers,
indicated that the species has a narrower concept in its morphology and
distribution. Other morphologically related taxa arise from this
taxonomic approach. Fulvifomes cedrelae is not accept as a synonym of F.
robiniae and Fulvifomes squamosus sp. nov. is described as new based on
Peruvian specimens. Based on morphology, phylogenetic relationships and
host distributions, the taxonomic implication for the genus and other
taxa are deeply discussed.
